page.title: 11The Parish Church
page.content: The Parish Church of All Saints, Mugginton with Kedleston, stands on a hill. From the churchyard one gets extensive views over the surrounding countryside, including the town of Derby and one of the Trent Valley power stations at Ratcliffe-on-Soar some 18 miles distant. It is thought that Mugginton has been a sight of Christian worship for over 1000 years, although little remains of the Saxon building. The present building is mainly 14th and 15th century, but the lower part of the tower is Norman. The oldest part of the nave is the west wall, in which there is an 11th century window above a late 12th century arch. The hollow yew tree in the churchyard is over 1000 years old and could have been a Druid tree. The Parish Church serves a rural
